title: Romance & Tenderness
description: Explore how romance and tenderness show up in your physical connection

questions.text: There's tenderness in how my partner touches me.

therapeutic.rationale: Tender touch communicates care and presence. When touch has tenderness, it feeds emotional as well as physical needs.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't experience tenderness, explore what tenderness looks like for them. The touching partner may express care differently.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience of tender touch deepens your emotional-physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does tenderness show up in your partner's touch?

questions.text: I feel cherished in our physical moments together.

therapeutic.rationale: Feeling cherished—not just wanted—adds a layer of emotional meaning to physical connection. This sense of being precious creates deep security.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel cherished, explore what would create that feeling. More words? Slower pace? Different approach?
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual feeling of being cherished makes physical moments emotionally nourishing.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes you feel cherished during physical moments?

questions.text: Romance still shows up in how we connect physically.

therapeutic.rationale: Romance in physical connection—intention, anticipation, specialness—keeps the spark alive. Without it, physical connection can become routine.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If romance has faded for one partner, explore what romance looks like for them and what would bring it back.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of ongoing romance enriches your physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What does romance in physical connection look like for you?

questions.text: My partner makes me feel special through physical affection.

therapeutic.rationale: Feeling special through affection—not just one of many possible recipients—creates secure attachment. This uniqueness communicates commitment.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel special, explore what would create that feeling. The other partner may assume it's obvious.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual feeling of being made special through affection strengthens your bond.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes your partner's affection feel special to you?

questions.text: There's warmth and care in how we are physical together.

therapeutic.rationale: Warmth and care as the tone of physical connection creates safety. Without this underlying warmth, physical contact can feel mechanical or disconnected.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If warmth and care are missing for one partner, explore what would bring more of it. Intention? Presence? Words?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience of warmth and care creates a loving physical dynamic.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What creates the sense of warmth and care in your physical connection?
